body:
We bet on sports, horses and even ... dogs. And we bet on the stock market and on crypto. The latter is socially admired and not called betting. The former evokes images of dirty OTBs in the US. Scummy places, reservced for society's lowest. And yet we farking love all of it. Applying similarly logic to every discipline. Look for an edge. Bet. Admitedly, the difference being that you can absolutely do your balls at sports betting if you don't have an edge. The vig stacks against you, whereas, stock markets and crypto exchanges have only trended positively over time. Anyway, we digress. We love betting on crypto and buying ETFs, so we thought we'd recommend one of the most popular trading platforms on the planet, eToro. In the eToro review, we'll discuss the strengths, weaknesses and why we bet with them. We'll keep the format similar to our sportsbook review in terms of markets offered, UX experience and fees (odds). So let's get it on. - - - ## **Who Is eToro?** Unibet is a European monster, based out of Malta. They operate in 100+ countries and are part of the Kindred Group, which you may or may not have heard of. They also have their own online casino. Which you can probably access too, depending on your location. - - - ## **eToro Review** Here is our executive summary of the eToro Review: ![etoro review](/images/uploads/3.png "etoro review") - - - ## **Join eToro Now**

title: eToro Review: Socially Admired Gambling
description: Have you seen the Alec Baldwin ads and want an eToro Review? Then come on over. We're discussing UX, markets and fees, plus more in this exclusive eToro Review.
